description: Manage Azure NetApp Files (ANF) Account active directories.

commands.name: az netappfiles account ad add
commands.summary: Add an active directory to the account.
commands.syntax:
az netappfiles account ad add --account-name
                              --resource-group
                              [--active-directory-id]
                              [--ad-name]
                              [--administrators]
                              [--aes-encryption {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--allow-local-ldap-users {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--backup-operators]
                              [--dns]
                              [--domain]
                              [--encrypt-dc-conn {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--kdc-ip]
                              [--ldap-over-tls {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--ldap-search-scope]
                              [--ldap-signing {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--organizational-unit]
                              [--password]
                              [--preferred-servers-for-ldap-client]
                              [--security-operators]
                              [--server-root-ca-cert]
                              [--site]
                              [--smb-server-name]
                              [--username]
examples: az netappfiles account ad add -g mygroup -a myname --username aduser --password aduser --smb-server-name SMBSERVER --dns 1.2.3.4 --domain westcentralus

commands.name: az netappfiles account ad list
commands.summary: List the active directories of an account.
examples: az netappfiles account ad list -g mygroup -a myname

commands.name: az netappfiles account ad remove
commands.summary: Remove an active directory from the account.
commands.syntax:
az netappfiles account ad remove --account-name
                                 --active-directory
                                 --resource-group
                                 [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                 [--yes]
examples: az netappfiles account ad remove -g mygroup --name myname --active-directory-id 13641da9-c0e9-4b97-84fc-4f8014a93848

commands.name: az netappfiles account ad show
commands.summary: Get the specified ANF active directory.
examples: az netappfiles account ad show -g mygroup --name myname --active-directory-id 13641da9-c0e9-4b97-84fc-4f8014a93848

commands.name: az netappfiles account ad update
commands.summary: Updates an active directory to the account.
commands.syntax:
az netappfiles account ad update --account-name
                                 --active-directory-id
                                 --resource-group
                                 [--ad-name]
                                 [--add]
                                 [--administrators]
                                 [--aes-encryption {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                 [--allow-local-ldap-users {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                 [--backup-operators]
                                 [--dns]
                                 [--domain]
                                 [--encrypt-dc-connections {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                 [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                 [--kdc-ip]
                                 [--ldap-over-tls {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                 [--ldap-search-scope]
                                 [--ldap-signing {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                 [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                 [--organizational-unit]
                                 [--password]
                                 [--preferred-servers-for-ldap-client]
                                 [--remove]
                                 [--security-operators]
                                 [--server-root-ca-cert]
                                 [--set]
                                 [--site]
                                 [--smb-server-name]
                                 [--username]
examples: az netappfiles account ad update -g mygroup --name myname --active-directory-id 13641da9-c0e9-4b97-84fc-4f8014a93848 --username ad_username --password ad_password --domain northeurope --dns 1.2.3.4 --smb-server-name SMBSERVER

commands.name: az netappfiles account ad wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
